intro: Spermacoce chaetocephala var. minor, commonly known as the small hairy spermacoce, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and hairy leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. It is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats.
